intro: Mespilodaphne ceanothifolia, commonly known as the white-flowered hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, round fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and horticultural collections.
